quotes.quote: “Think and talk like the person you intend to become; complaining is a waste of time and destiny; talk regarding you; and act alike.”
quotes.author: Daniel ANIKOR

quotes.quote: “Whoever that is leading does not sacrifice the rope of togetherness, else he will be destroying what he has built hitherto.”
quotes.author: Daniel ANIKOR

quotes.quote: “Someone told me the morning runs are the best healings and I was really curious to to know and yes he was right.
quotes.author: Devashish kaushik

quotes.quote: “Dušo,
quotes.author: Djura Kelj

quotes.quote: “Darling, buoys can't confine the sea.”
quotes.author: Djura Kelj

quotes.quote: “الاخلاق دائما تؤدي إلي وجود العقل ..... حيث هي ثابتة اما تتطورها فهو ليس منها ولكن بسبب من يقوم بهدمها و هو ليس العقل بل الفشل ...... هشام نيبر”
quotes.author: Hesham Nebr

quotes.quote: “My passion shone through my words, captivating the reader’s attention and fostering a connection.”
quotes.author: Bachir Bastien

quotes.quote: “Identifying your motivation as a writer serves as a compass, guiding the creative journey with purpose and clarity.”
quotes.author: Bachir Bastien

quotes.quote: “Don't let the past determine the present moment because it has no power over it.”
quotes.author: Kenroy Givans

quotes.quote: “Do not be petrified while looking behind; burn all the bridges! The only correct path is always, ever forward.”
quotes.author: Danilo Vukovljak

quotes.quote: “Life Is Meant To Realize Yourself as a Divine Being.”
quotes.author: Shiva Negi

quotes.quote: “Focus on the positives, look toward the future. Concentrate on where you want to be, how you want to feel, and remind yourself of that every hour of everyday until you believe it. Until you no longer have to repeat it. Know where you are going and only focus on that, stop dwelling on the rest”
quotes.author: Leddy Harper

quotes.quote: “The beauty of conversation lies in its ability to connect us with others and ourselves. It’s about being heard and understood, and in that understanding, finding clarity. Sharing our journey with others, especially when we feel lost, can be a beacon of light, guiding us towards a path that feels right.”
quotes.author: Elvis Tapfumanei

quotes.quote: “No one can teach you the better than adversity.”

quotes.quote: “What I've realised is that each event in our lives brings us closer to who we're supposed to be and to what we're supposed to do.”

quotes.quote: “Understanding why things happen the way that they do makes you better prepared to face them.”

quotes.quote: “If you want to be happy, try never to be negative. As a plan, it is unproductive and does not work.”

quotes.quote: “Kadar imaš polno rit vsega, ni noben stol dovolj udoben.”

quotes.quote: “Every challenge in life is an opportunity to polish your skills.”

quotes.quote: “Above all, surround yourself with friends who make you laugh, especially if you live with them. When they no longer make you laugh, throw them out and recycle them.”

quotes.quote: “Contribute. Be bold!”

quotes.quote: “We are never fucking brave enough.”
quotes.author: Gordon Roddick

quotes.quote: “Life from the other end.”
quotes.author: Gordon Roddick

quotes.quote: “Live by your own conventions.”
quotes.author: Gordon Roddick

quotes.quote: “More symptoms of what my inner engine reveals – nothing ordered, nothing built on logic.”

I only became attractive (to myself) when I broke out of that and had bursts of rip-roaring, disgusting behaviour. It was funny and hurt no one.”

Now, that's how I feel about life. It's taken me a long time to get here, but now I see that the promise of the mountain is everywhere.”

quotes.quote: “As a Democrat, I embrace the power of unity, compassion, and progress. I believe in a society where every voice is heard, every dream is nurtured, and every individual is valued. We strive for a future where justice prevails over inequality, where opportunity knows no bounds, and where the pursuit of happiness is not a privilege, but a birthright. We champion the rights of the marginalized, the protection of our planet, and the strength of our diversity. With courage in our hearts and resilience in our souls, we march forward, guided by the principles of equality, empathy, and the unwavering belief that together, we can build a brighter tomorrow for all. For I am a Democrat, and I stand unwavering in my commitment to forging a better, more inclusive world.”

quotes.quote: “I deserve it all, the good and the bad.”

quotes.quote: “I could waste my time counting all the hurts that you have caused me. But I choose to rebuild myself by counting all the strong points that I still have in me.”

quotes.quote: “Then there is the callous side, the war-wracked sentiment, the notion that a Band-Aid was ripped from the bullet wound. The fear for what comes next, the longing many Afghans have to leave, the unraveling humanitarian catastrophe, the hunger pains fused with the ache of abandonment.”
quotes.author: Hollie McKay

quotes.quote: “Somehow, we must let go of the past and remember it at the same time. We must embrace the reality that is, not the reality we want to be, and do what we can to be a helping hand.”

quotes.quote: “We can pontificate all day about statistics and percentages and death tolls and displacement numbers, easily forgetting that numbers have names and names have faces. Each face has wrinkles that make up a map filled with tragedies to tell.”

quotes.quote: “Little girls smile through their sadness, women weep, and hunger burns through the hollow lives of those who plead for someone, anyone, to listen to their misery.”

quotes.quote: “What would you do if rockets barraged your home and you had nowhere to hide? What would you take if you only had ten seconds to fill a plastic bag? Where would you go if every street you turned onto was filled with fighters? Who would you save if all your children were buried beneath the rubble and crying?”

quotes.quote: “Children still fly kites from high on the hilltop, shrieking in delight as the nylon floats off toward the sunshine as if it was the most magnificent thrill in the world. All I can think to say, hoping those small boys could hear me, is 'fly on.”

quotes.quote: “I think of an Afghan driver I once had, a medical student who spoke whimsically of the homeland he loved so dearly but so badly wanted to leave. 'We Afghans are unlucky people,' the driver had whispered. "But we would be the luckiest people if the wars ever left—look outside at this magical place.”
quotes.author: Hollie McKay

quotes.quote: “The sounds of music have dimmed into a self-censored silence. We pause, we gaze for far too long at the markets from a broken window where Kabul's finest orchestras weeks ago were still learning to play. We linger, remembering what used to be.”

quotes.quote: “In the end, it came down to tea and talking just as much as bullets and butchery.”

quotes.quote: “My view from the window consists of mounds of clay dried to dust. Burqa-clad beggars sit with their babies beside bombed-out roads, waiting for those passing by to throw a coin or a bottle of water their way.”

quotes.quote: “Through you, through you, through you... The magic works through you. Not beside you. Not around you. Not for you. Not despite you. But through you. You have to go there. You have to choose your stage. You have to do your dance. Putting yourself in place, to any degree that you can, even if it scares you, even when it's "hard," even if it's just your big toe. Stretch yourself, scoff at the odds, get the ball rolling so that the magic can then come alive and sweep you off your feet with its infinite grace and glory. You wouldn't just carry around the seeds for the garden of your dreams in your pocket, all the while asking where your flowers were? Nope, you'd have to brave the elements, you'd have to choose the location, and then you'd have to go there. Your life is your wand.”
quotes.author: Mike Dooley

quotes.quote: “If you wish to be paid, you must be willing to work.”

quotes.quote: “Keeping negative energies and people at the bay will solve all your problems!”

quotes.quote: “What motivates us? Challenge. What moves us? Challenge. What makes us better and stronger and more courageous? Challenge. Embrace the challenge, people!”
quotes.author: Anna Moore Bradfield

quotes.quote: “The time we spend here on earth is like a droplet in a pail of eternity. Yet that one droplet affects all the others in that bucket.”
quotes.author: Anna Moore Bradfield

quotes.quote: “To be distracted by the agendas or opinions of others is to keep us at a distance from our dreams.”
quotes.author: Anna Moore Bradfield

quotes.quote: “I want to mean something, to leave my mark, to rest in the assurance that people were better off having known me.”
quotes.author: Anna Moore Bradfield

quotes.quote: “Maybe prayer isn't just SOMEthing we can do in certain situations. Maybe it's the BEST thing.”
quotes.author: Anna Moore Bradfield

quotes.quote: “Don't stop until you get five-finger clarity on your values and beliefs.”
quotes.author: Anna Moore Bradfield

quotes.quote: “I make a conscious effort to compliment at least one person every time I'm out and about. One nice comment can change a person's entire mood and mindset for the day.”

quotes.quote: “There is much to express, not with eyes or lips, but with dancing steps.”

quotes.quote: “It matters not how you dance, as long as each step narrates the emotions of the heart.”

quotes.quote: “Writing does not make me rich, but I am enriched every day I write.”
quotes.author: B.K. Sweeting

quotes.quote: “Filter out the irrelevant noise. Focus on the objective.”
quotes.author: Robin S. Baker

quotes.quote: “Sometimes when we're feeling stuck in a rut, we can get clear by physically decluttering our homes. Getting rid of objects that hold past hurtful memories to them and moving out the things that takes up too much space for no reason.”
quotes.author: Robin S. Baker

quotes.quote: “Most late bloomers win big at life in their older years. Don't sleep on the unnoticed and the underrated. The wheel of fortune will eventually turn in their favor.”
quotes.author: Robin S. Baker

quotes.quote: “Try to revise your strategy before quitting something you've been working diligently at. Don't change the destination yet, because a different route may be the answer.”
quotes.author: Robin S. Baker

quotes.quote: “There aren't many days that I'm not writing. Practice makes progress.”
quotes.author: Robin S. Baker

quotes.quote: “The path you feel most called to travel on, is the most secure and protected route. Trust your inner compass.”
quotes.author: Robin S. Baker

quotes.quote: “Footsteps find the purpose to exist when arrives the blessing of dance.”
quotes.author: Shah Asad Rizvi

quotes.quote: “Intent is meant to dance when steps and melodies combine.”
quotes.author: Shah Asad Rizvi

quotes.quote: “Slow or fast, each dance step narrates the emotions of the heart.”

quotes.quote: “In moments of sorrow or when the heart breaks, allow dance to take away all the pain.”

quotes.quote: “Moments of life become a magical storyline when you take the stance of dance.”

quotes.quote: “No matter your age, time, or place, the connection with dance will always remain.”

quotes.quote: “While listening to drum beats or trance, now is the time to release the dance.”

quotes.quote: “Feel the adrenaline rushing down your spine, take a little chance, for it is time to dance.”
quotes.author: Shah Asad Rizvi

quotes.quote: “Across space and time, terrestrial and celestial, every being represents its dance.”
quotes.author: Shah Asad Rizvi

quotes.quote: “A wise person understands the value in asking questions.”
quotes.author: Robin S. Baker

quotes.quote: “You can initiate a phase of death and rebirth at any time. You don't have to sit idle and wait for an outside force to make that happen for you. Choose to end things. This will always spark an opportunity for a new beginning.”
quotes.author: Robin S. Baker

quotes.quote: “Meditation is a gift. It's not only utilized for mental and emotional peace. It is also a way for us to connect and receive information from other Sources.
quotes.author: Robin S. Baker

quotes.quote: “You have authority over your life. Your life force is expanding. Your potential is limitless. Tap in and prepare yourself to climb the ladder of all that you desire. It is yours to have.”
quotes.author: Robin S. Baker

quotes.quote: “Don't get discouraged in times of difficulties.”
quotes.author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quotes.quote: “I will always be a student of life.”
quotes.author: Robin S. Baker

quotes.quote: “We need more wise leaders and innovators. We need less of, "The blind leading the blind", type of activity.”
quotes.author: Robin S. Baker

quotes.quote: “Invest in yourself. You'll make the money back. Just keep an abundant mindset.”
quotes.author: Robin S. Baker

quotes.quote: “Burnout will have you taking a pause for weeks, months, and even years. Take care of yourself and prioritize your overall needs. You will actually have better results after some much-needed time of relaxation.
quotes.author: Robin S. Baker

quotes.quote: “Many of you should not be hiding your talents from the world because, wow, you are extremely gifted.”
quotes.author: Robin S. Baker

quotes.quote: “Power to work is necessary for progress.”
quotes.author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quotes.quote: “A smile puts you on the right track. A smile makes the world a beautiful place. When you lose your smile, you lose your way in the chaos of life.”
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “I have no faith in human perfectibility. I think that human exertion will have no appreciable effect upon humanity. Man is now only more active - not more happy - nor more wise, than he was 6000 years ago.”
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.quote: “A mathematical formula for happiness:Reality divided by Expectations.There were two ways to be happy:improve your reality or lower your expectations.”

quotes.quote: “Happiness is not a goal...it's a by-product of a life well lived.”

quotes.quote: “The power of finding beauty in the humblest things makes home happy and life lovely.”

quotes.quote: “We should always make time for the things we like. If we don't, we might forget how to be happy.”

quotes.quote: “I, not events, have the power to make me happy or unhappy today. I can choose which it shall be. Yesterday is dead, tomorrow hasn't arrived yet. I have just one day, today, and I'm going to be happy in it.”

quotes.quote: “Perfectionism is the enemy of happiness. Embrace being perfectly imperfect. Learn from your mistakes and forgive yourself, you’ll be happier. We make mistakes because we are imperfect. Learn from your mistakes, forgive yourself, and keep moving forward.”

quotes.quote: “Children are happy because they don't have a file in their minds called "All the Things That Could Go Wrong.”

quotes.quote: “You are in charge of your own happiness; you don't need to wait for other people's permission to be happy.”

quotes.quote: “It does not matter how long you are spending on the earth, how much money you have gathered or how much attention you have received. It is the amount of positive vibration you have radiated in life that matters,”
quotes.author: Amit Ray

quotes.quote: “I find the best way to love someone is not to change them, but instead, help them reveal the greatest version of themselves.”
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.quote: “There is no happiness like that of being loved by your fellow creatures, and feeling that your presence is an addition to their comfort.”
quotes.author: Charlotte Brontë

quotes.quote: “With all its sham, drudgery, and broken dreams,
quotes.author: Max Ehrmann

quotes.quote: “And I can't be running back and fourth forever between grief and high delight.”
quotes.author: J.D. Salinger

quotes.quote: “People are unhappy when they get something too easily. You have to sweat--that's the only moral they know.”
quotes.author: Dany Laferrière

quotes.quote: “A thing of beauty is a joy forever.”
quotes.author: John Keats

quotes.quote: “The pain I feel now is the happiness I had before. That's the deal.”
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.quote: “Let us dance in the sun, wearing wild flowers in our hair...”
quotes.author: susan polis schutz

quotes.quote: “Ah, what happiness it is to be with people who are all happy, to press hands, press cheeks, smile into eyes.”
quotes.author: Katherine Mansfield

quotes.quote: “It is an illusion that youth is happy, an illusion of those who have lost it; but the young know they are wretched for they are full of the truthless ideal which have been instilled into them, and each time they come in contact with the real, they are bruised and wounded. It looks as if they were victims of a conspiracy; for the books they read, ideal by the necessity of selection, and the conversation of their elders, who look back upon the past through a rosy haze of forgetfulness, prepare them for an unreal life. They must discover for themselves that all they have read and all they have been told are lies, lies, lies; and each discovery is another nail driven into the body on the cross of life.”
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: “The sense of unhappiness is so much easier to convey than that of happiness. In misery we seem aware of our own existence, even though it may be in the form of a monstrous egotism: this pain of mine is individual, this nerve that winces belongs to me and to no other. But happiness annihilates us: we lose our identity.”
quotes.author: Graham Greene

quotes.quote: “The greater part of our happiness or misery depends upon our dispositions, and not upon our circumstances.”
quotes.author: Martha Washington

quotes.quote: “That's the difference between me and the rest of the world! Happiness isn't good enough for me! I demand euphoria!”
quotes.author: Bill Watterson

quotes.quote: “Happiness consists in frequent repetition of pleasure”
quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quotes.quote: “If you don't want a man unhappy politically, don't give him two sides to a question to worry him; give him one. Better yet, give him none. Let him forget there is such a thing as war. If the government is inefficient, top-heavy, and tax-mad, better it be all those than that people worry over it. Peace, Montag. Give the people contests they win by remembering the words to more popular songs or the names of state capitals or how much corn Iowa grew last year. Cram them full of noncombustible data, chock them so damned full of 'facts' they feel stuffed, but absolutely 'brilliant' with information. Then they'll feel they're thinking, they'll get aof motion without moving. And they'll be happy, because facts of that sort don't change.”
quotes.author: Ray Bradbury

quotes.quote: “What can I do with my happiness? How can I keep it, conceal it, bury it where I may never lose it? I want to kneel as it falls over me like rain, gather it up with lace and silk, and press it over myself again.”
quotes.author: Anais Nin

quotes.quote: “Everyone wants to live on top of the mountain, but all the happiness and growth occurs while you're climbing it.”
quotes.author: Andy Rooney

quotes.quote: “The only time you fail is when you fall down and stay down.”
quotes.author: Stephen Richards

quotes.quote: “I am a happy camper so I guess I’m doing something right. Happiness is like a butterfly; the more you chase it, the more it will elude you, but if you turn your attention to other things, it will come and sit softly on your shoulder.”
quotes.author: J. Richard Lessor

quotes.quote: “The only way to find true happiness is to risk being completely cut open.”
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.quote: “Name one hero who was happy."
quotes.author: Madeline Miller

quotes.quote: “Hope
quotes.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quotes.quote: “Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness.”
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: “Be grateful for what you already have while you pursue your goals.
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “Sanity and happiness are an impossible combination.”
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: “You can't be happy unless you're unhappy sometimes".”
quotes.author: Lauren Oliver

quotes.quote: “Top 15 Things Money Can’t Buy
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “Letting go means to come to the realization that some people are a part of your history, but not a part of your destiny.”
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.quote: “The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.”
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: “It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will.”
quotes.author: Lucy Maud Montgomery

quotes.quote: “Happiness is the consequence of personal effort. You fight for it, strive for it, insist upon it, and sometimes even travel around the world looking for it. You have to participate relentlessly in the manifestations of your own blessings. And once you have achieved a state of happiness, you must never become lax about maintaining it. You must make a mighty effort to keep swimming upward into that happiness forever, to stay afloat on top of it.”
quotes.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quotes.quote: “Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get”
quotes.author: W.P. Kinsella

quotes.quote: “Happiness [is] only real when shared”
quotes.author: Jon Krakauer

quotes.quote: “Always find opportunities to make someone smile, and to offer random acts of kindness in everyday life.”
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “I've got nothing to do today but smile.”
quotes.author: Simon and Garfunkel

quotes.quote: “I must learn to be content with being happier than I deserve.”
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: “Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness.”
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.quote: “Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness.”
quotes.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quotes.quote: “Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.”
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.quote: “Happiness is holding someone in your arms and knowing you hold the whole world.”
quotes.author: Orhan Pamuk

quotes.quote: “I am not proud, but I am happy; and happiness blinds, I think, more than pride.”
quotes.author: Alexandre Dumas

quotes.quote: “Stop comparing yourself to other people, just choose to be happy and live your own life.”
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “please believe that things are good with me, and even when they're not, they will be soon enough. And i will always believe the same about you.”
quotes.author: Stephen Chbosky

quotes.quote: “When the first baby laughed for the first time, its laugh broke into a thousand pieces, and they all went skipping about, and that was the beginning of fairies.”
quotes.author: J.M. Barrie

quotes.quote: “The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good things for the first time.”
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: “The best way to cheer yourself is to try to cheer someone else up.”
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: “All happiness depends on courage and work.”
quotes.author: Honoré de Balzac

quotes.quote: “Don't aim at success. The more you aim at it and make it a target, the more you are going to miss it. For success, like happiness, cannot be pursued; it must ensue, and it only does so as the unintended side effect of one's personal dedication to a cause greater than oneself or as the by-product of one's surrender to a person other than oneself. Happiness must happen, and the same holds for success: you have to let it happen by not caring about it. I want you to listen to what your conscience commands you to do and go on to carry it out to the best of your knowledge. Then you will live to see that in the long-run—in the long-run, I say!—success will follow you precisely because you had forgotten to think about it”
quotes.author: Viktor E. Frankl

quotes.quote: “I'm happy. Which often looks like crazy.”
quotes.author: David Henry Hwang

quotes.quote: “For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.”
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: “Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own.”
quotes.author: Robert A. Heinlein

quotes.quote: “Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be.”
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: “Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time.”
quotes.author: Marthe Troly-Curtin

quotes.quote: “It's so hard to forget pain, but it's even harder to remember sweetness. We have no scar to show for happiness. We learn so little from peace.”
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.quote: “Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know.”
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.quote: “You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.”
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: “The Seven Social Sins are:
quotes.author: Frederick Lewis Donaldson

quotes.quote: “Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.”
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: “Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad.”
quotes.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.quote: “There's nothing like deep breaths after laughing that hard. Nothing in the world like a sore stomach for the right reasons.”
quotes.author: Stephen Chbosky

quotes.quote: “Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears.”
quotes.author: John Lennon

quotes.quote: “Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.”
quotes.author: Dalai Lama XIV

quotes.quote: “If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world.”
quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quotes.quote: “Promise Yourself
quotes.author: Christian D. Larson

quotes.quote: “Attitude is a choice. Happiness is a choice. Optimism is a choice. Kindness is a choice. Giving is a choice. Respect is a choice. Whatever choice you make makes you. Choose wisely.”
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “They say a person needs just three things to be truly happy in this world: someone to love, something to do, and something to hope for.”
quotes.author: Tom Bodett

quotes.quote: “Take responsibility of your own happiness, never put it in other people’s hands.”
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “The most important thing is to enjoy your life—to be happy—it's all that matters.”
quotes.author: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.quote: “Happiness is a warm puppy.”
quotes.author: Charles M. Schulz

quotes.quote: “You cannot protect yourself from sadness without protecting yourself from happiness.”
quotes.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quotes.quote: “Don’t waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.”
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “It isn't what you have or who you are or where you are or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about it.”
quotes.author: Dale Carnegie

quotes.quote: “Even if you cannot change all the people around you, you can change the people you choose to be around. Life is too short to waste your time on people who don’t respect, appreciate, and value you. Spend your life with people who make you smile, laugh, and feel loved.”
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “No medicine cures what happiness cannot.”
quotes.author: Gabriel García Márquez

quotes.quote: “Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city.”
quotes.author: George Burns

quotes.quote: “Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.”
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.quote: “I felt my lungs inflate with the onrush of scenery—air, mountains, trees, people. I thought, "This is what it is to be happy.”
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath

quotes.quote: “If you want to be happy, do not dwell in the past, do not worry about the future, focus on living fully in the present.”
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.”
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: “The problem with people is they forget that most of the time it's the small things that count.”
quotes.author: Jennifer Niven

quotes.quote: “Ester asked why people are sad.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.quote: “There are two ways to get enough. One is to continue to accumulate more and more. The other is to desire less.”
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: “We don’t even ask happiness, just a little less pain.”
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski

quotes.quote: “Smile more. Smiling can make you and others happy.”
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “Happily ever after, or even just together ever after, is not cheesy,” Wren said. “It’s the noblest, like, the most courageous thing two people can shoot for.”
quotes.author: Rainbow Rowell

quotes.quote: “The trouble is that we have a bad habit, encouraged by pedants and sophisticates, of considering happiness as something rather stupid. Only pain is intellectual, only evil interesting. This is the treason of the artist; a refusal to admit the banality of evil and the terrible boredom of pain.”
quotes.author: Ursula K. LeGuin

quotes.quote: “Sadness gives depth. Happiness gives height. Sadness gives roots. Happiness gives branches. Happiness is like a tree going into the sky, and sadness is like the roots going down into the womb of the earth. Both are needed, and the higher a tree goes, the deeper it goes, simultaneously. The bigger the tree, the bigger will be its roots. In fact, it is always in proportion. That's its balance.”
quotes.author: Osho Rajneesh

quotes.quote: “Maybe the truth is, there's a little bit of loser in all of us. Being happy isn't having everything in your life be perfect. Maybe it's about stringing together all the little things.”
quotes.author: Ann Brashares

quotes.quote: “I have a million things to talk to you about. All I want in this world is you. I want to see you and talk. I want the two of us to begin everything from the beginning.”
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami

quotes.quote: “This planet has - or rather had - a problem, which was this: most of the people living on it were unhappy for pretty much of the time. Many solutions were suggested for this problem, but most of these were largely concerned with the movement of small green pieces of paper, which was odd because on the whole it wasn't the small green pieces of paper that were unhappy.”
quotes.author: Douglas Adams

quotes.quote: “Stop giving other people the power to control your happiness, your mind, and your life. If you don't take control of yourself and your own life, someone else is bound to try.”
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “Those who are not looking for happiness are the most likely to find it, because those who are searching forget that the surest way to be happy is to seek happiness for others.”
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.quote: “You’ll learn, as you get older, that rules are made to be broken. Be bold enough to live life on your terms, and never, ever apologize for it. Go against the grain, refuse to conform, take the road less traveled instead of the well-beaten path. Laugh in the face of adversity, and leap before you look. Dance as though EVERYBODY is watching. March to the beat of your own drummer. And stubbornly refuse to fit in.”
quotes.author: Mandy Hale

quotes.quote: “Happiness is an accident of nature, a beautiful and flawless aberration.”
quotes.author: Pat Conroy

quotes.quote: “Laughter is poison to fear.”
quotes.author: George R.R. Martin

quotes.quote: “Happiness is not a possession to be prized, it is a quality of thought, a state of mind.”
quotes.author: Daphne Du Maurier

quotes.quote: “Keep your best wishes, close to your heart and watch what happens”
quotes.author: Tony DeLiso

quotes.quote: “Letting go gives us freedom, and freedom is the only condition for happiness. If, in our heart, we still cling to anything - anger, anxiety, or possessions - we cannot be free.”
quotes.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quotes.quote: “The secret of happiness is freedom, the secret of freedom is courage.”
quotes.author: Carrie Jones

quotes.quote: “I'm choosing happiness over suffering, I know I am. I'm making space for the unknown future to fill up my life with yet-to-come surprises.”
quotes.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quotes.quote: “I will not try to convince you to love me, to respect me, to commit to me. I deserve better than that; I AM BETTER THAN THAT...Goodbye.”
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.quote: “Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.”
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: “It is the very mark of the spirit of rebellion to crave for happiness in this life”
quotes.author: Henrik Ibsen

quotes.quote: “Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself in your way of thinking.”
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: “My God, a moment of bliss. Why, isn't that enough for a whole lifetime?”
quotes.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quotes.quote: “After all, what is happiness? Love, they tell me. But love doesn't bring and never has brought happiness. On the contrary, it's a constant state of anxiety, a battlefield; it's sleepless nights, asking ourselves all the time if we're doing the right thing. Real love is composed of ecstasy and agony.”
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.quote: “Action may not always bring happiness, but there is no happiness without action. ”
quotes.author: William James

quotes.quote: “I think happiness is what makes you pretty. Period. Happy people are beautiful. They become like a mirror and they reflect that happiness.”
quotes.author: Drew Barrymore

quotes.quote: “I don’t know what’s worse: to not know what you are and be happy, or to become what you’ve always wanted to be, and feel alone.”
quotes.author: Daniel Keyes

quotes.quote: “Do not set aside your happiness. Do not wait to be happy in the future. The best time to be happy is always now.”
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. Be the living expression of God's kindness: kindness in your face, kindness in your eyes, kindness in your smile.”
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.quote: “Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.”
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.quote: “So we shall let the reader answer this question for himself: who is the happier man, he who has braved the storm of life and lived or he who has stayed securely on shore and merely existed?”
quotes.author: Hunter S. Thompson

quotes.quote: “I think and think and think, I‘ve thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it.”
quotes.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quotes.quote: “I'd far rather be happy than right any day.”
quotes.author: Douglas Adams

quotes.quote: “The grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.”
quotes.author: George Washington Burnap

quotes.quote: “It was only a sunny smile, and little it cost in the giving, but like morning light it scattered the night and made the day worth living.”
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quotes.quote: “Actual happiness always looks pretty squalid in comparison with the overcompensations for misery. And, of course, stability isn't nearly so spectacular as instability. And being contented has none of the glamour of a good fight against misfortune, none of the picturesqueness of a struggle with temptation, or a fatal overthrow by passion or doubt. Happiness is never grand.”
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: “True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future, not to amuse ourselves with either hopes or fears but to rest satisfied with what we have, which is sufficient, for he that is so wants nothing. The greatest blessings of mankind are within us and within our reach. A wise man is content with his lot, whatever it may be, without wishing for what he has not.”
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: “And hand in hand, on the edge of the sand,
quotes.author: Edward Lear

quotes.quote: “I felt once more how simple and frugal a thing is happiness: a glass of wine, a roast chestnut, a wretched little brazier, the sound of the sea. Nothing else.”
quotes.author: Nikos Kazantzakis

quotes.quote: “One of the keys to happiness is a bad memory.”
quotes.author: Rita Mae Brown

quotes.quote: “The more you feed your mind with positive thoughts, the more you can attract great things into your life.”
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “Happiness depends upon ourselves.”
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: “Happiness depends on your mindset and attitude.”
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “I know that's what people say-- you'll get over it. I'd say it, too. But I know it's not true. Oh, youll be happy again, never fear. But you won't forget. Every time you fall in love it will be because something in the man reminds you of him.”
quotes.author: Betty Smith

quotes.quote: “I do not miss childhood, but I miss the way I took pleasure in small things, even as greater things crumbled. I could not control the world I was in, could not walk away from things or people or moments that hurt, but I took joy in the things that made me happy.”
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman

quotes.quote: “I am the happiest creature in the world. Perhaps other people have said so before, but not one with such justice. I am happier even than Jane; she only smiles, I laugh.”
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: “Sometimes life knocks you on your ass... get up, get up, get up!!! Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.”
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.quote: “What, if some day or night a demon were to steal after you into your loneliest loneliness and say to you: 'This life as you now live it and have lived it, you will have to live once more and innumerable times more' ... Would you not throw yourself down and gnash your teeth and curse the demon who spoke thus? Or have you once experienced a tremendous moment when you would have answered him: 'You are a god and never have I heard anything more divine.”
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: “With mirth and laughter let old wrinkles come.”
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: “A quiet secluded life in the country, with the possibility of being useful to people to whom it is easy to do good, and who are not accustomed to have it done to them; then work which one hopes may be of some use; then rest, nature, books, music, love for one's neighbor — such is my idea of happiness.”
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.quote: “Now and then it's good to pause in our pursuit of happiness and just be happy.”
quotes.author: Guillaume Apollinaire

quotes.quote: “People like to say love is unconditional, but it's not, and even if it was unconditional, it's still never free. There's always an expectation attached. They always want something in return. Like they want you to be happy or whatever and that makes you automatically responsible for their happiness because they won't be happy unless you are ... I just don't want that responsibility.”
quotes.author: Katja Millay

quotes.quote: “Part of the problem with the word 'disabilities' is that it immediately suggests an inability to see or hear or walk or do other things that many of us take for granted. But what of people who can't feel? Or talk about their feelings? Or manage their feelings in constructive ways? What of people who aren't able to form close and strong relationships? And people who cannot find fulfillment in their lives, or those who have lost hope, who live in disappointment and bitterness and find in life no joy, no love? These, it seems to me, are the real disabilities.”
quotes.author: Fred Rogers

quotes.quote: “Happiness makes up in height for what it lacks in length.”
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.quote: “There is some kind of a sweet innocence in being human- in not having to be just happy or just sad- in the nature of being able to be both broken and whole, at the same time.”
quotes.author: C. JoyBell C.

quotes.quote: “There is nothing more rare, nor more beautiful, than a woman being unapologetically herself; comfortable in her perfect imperfection. To me, that is the true essence of beauty.”
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.quote: “Many people think excitement is happiness.... But when you are excited you are not peaceful. True happiness is based on peace.”
quotes.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quotes.quote: “Humanity does not ask us to be happy. It merely asks us to be brilliant on its behalf.”
quotes.author: Orson Scott Card

quotes.quote: “It's a helluva start, being able to recognize what makes you happy. ”
quotes.author: Lucille Ball

quotes.quote: “People wait around too long for love. I'm happy with all of my lusts!”
quotes.author: C. JoyBell C.

quotes.quote: “A flower blossoms for its own joy.”
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: “When you are joyful, when you say yes to life and have fun and project positivity all around you, you become a sun in the center of every constellation, and people want to be near you.”
quotes.author: Shannon L. Alder

quotes.quote: “I think the saddest people always try their hardest to make people happy because they know what it’s like to feel absolutely worthless and they don’t want anyone else to feel like that.”
quotes.author: Robin Williams

quotes.quote: “Happiness doesn't result from what we get, but from what we give.”
quotes.author: Ben Carson

quotes.quote: “it is impossible to build one's own happiness on the unhappiness of others. This perspective is at the heart of Buddhist teachings.”
quotes.author: Daisaku Ikeda

quotes.quote: “Some people are so much sunshine to the square inch.”
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.quote: “I don’t think man was meant to attain happiness so easily. Happiness is like those palaces in fairy tales whose gates are guarded by dragons: we must fight in order to conquer it.”
quotes.author: Alexandre Dumas

quotes.quote: “Those who are happiest are those who do the most for others.”
quotes.author: Booker T. Washington

quotes.quote: “Expectations make people miserable, so whatever yours are, lower them. You'll definitely be happier.”
quotes.author: Simone Elkeles

quotes.quote: “Ô, Sunlight! The most precious gold to be found on Earth.”
quotes.author: Roman Payne

quotes.quote: “But maybe happiness isn't in the choosing. Maybe it's in the fiction, in the pretending: that wherever we have ended up is where we intended to be all along.”
quotes.author: Lauren Oliver

quotes.quote: “Happiness comes from within. It is not dependent on external things or on other people. You become vulnerable and can be easily hurt when your feelings of security and happiness depend on the behavior and actions of other people. Never give your power to anyone else.”
quotes.author: Brian Weiss

quotes.quote: “To be stupid, and selfish, and to have good health are the three requirements for happiness - though if stupidity is lacking, the others are useless.”
quotes.author: Julian Barnes

quotes.quote: “The great source of both the misery and disorders of human life, seems to arise from over-rating the difference between one permanent situation and another. Avarice over-rates the difference between poverty and riches: ambition, that between a private and a public station: vain-glory, that between obscurity and extensive reputation. The person under the influence of any of those extravagant passions, is not only miserable in his actual situation, but is often disposed to disturb the peace of society, in order to arrive at that which he so foolishly admires. The slightest observation, however, might satisfy him, that, in all the ordinary situations of human life, a well-disposed mind may be equally calm, equally cheerful, and equally contented. Some of those situations may, no doubt, deserve to be preferred to others: but none of them can deserve to be pursued with that passionate ardour which drives us to violate the rules either of prudence or of justice; or to corrupt the future tranquillity of our minds, either by shame from the remembrance of our own folly, or by remorse from the horror of our own injustice.”
quotes.author: Adam Smith

quotes.quote: “So he tasted the deep pain that is reserved only for the strong, just as he had tasted for a little while the deep happiness.”
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quotes.quote: “It's a funny thing about life, once you begin to take note of the things you are grateful for, you begin to lose sight of the things that you lack.”
quotes.author: Germany Kent

quotes.quote: “Those born to wealth, and who have the means of gratifying every wish, know not what is the real happiness of life, just as those who have been tossed on the stormy waters of the ocean on a few frail planks can alone realize the blessings of fair weather.”
quotes.author: Alexandre Dumas

quotes.quote: “Truly amazing, what people can get used to, as long as there are a few compensations.”
quotes.author: Margaret Atwood

quotes.quote: “Life is such unutterable hell, solely because it is sometimes beautiful. If we could only be miserable all the time, if there could be no such things as love or beauty or faith or hope, if I could be absolutely certain that my love would never be returned: how much more simple life would be. One could plod through the Siberian salt mines of existence without being bothered about happiness. Unfortunately the happiness is there. There is always the chance (about eight hundred and fifty to one) that another heart will come to mine. I can't help hoping, and keeping faith, and loving beauty. Quite frequently I am not so miserable as it would be wise to be.”
quotes.author: T.H. White

quotes.quote: “Can a person steal happiness? Or is just another internal, infernal human trick?”
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.quote: “These... things, householder, are welcome, agreeable, pleasant, & hard to obtain in the world:
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.quote: “Singing in the rain. I'm singing in the rain. And it's such a fucking glorious feeling. An unexpected downpour and I am just giving myself into it. Because what the fuck else can you do? Run for cover? Shriek and curse? No--when the rain falls you just let it fall and you grin like a madman and you dance with it because if you can make yourself happy in the rain, then you're doing pretty alright in life.”
quotes.author: David Levithan

quotes.quote: “Happiness is part of who we are. Joy is the feeling”
quotes.author: Tony DeLiso

quotes.quote: “Hide yourself in God, so when a man wants to find you he will have to go there first.”
quotes.author: Shannon L. Alder

quotes.quote: “Happiness, you see, its just an illusion of Fate, a heavenly sleight of hand designed to make you believe in fairy tales. But there's no happily ever after. You'll only find happy endings in books. Some books.”
quotes.author: Ellen Hopkins

quotes.quote: “Until you make peace with who you are, you'll never be content with what you have.”
quotes.author: Doris Mortman

quotes.quote: “Why Not You?
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.quote: “When you find a guy who calls you beautiful instead of hot, who calls you back when you hang up on him, who will stand in front of you when other’s cast stones, or will stay awake just to watch you sleep, who wants to show you off to the world when you are in sweats, who will hold your hand when your sick, who thinks your pretty without makeup, the one who turns to his friends and say, ‘that’s her’, the one that would bear your rejection because losing you means losing his will to live, who kisses you when you screw up, watches the stars and names one for you and will hold and rock that baby for hours so you can sleep…..you marry him all over again.”
quotes.author: Shannon Alder

quotes.quote: “Pierre was right when he said that one must believe in the possibility of happiness in order to be happy, and I now believe in it. Let the dead bury the dead, but while I'm alive, I must live and be happy.”
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.quote: “I don't know what good it is to know so much and be smart as whips and all if it doesn't make you happy.”
quotes.author: J.D. Salinger

quotes.quote: “They've got no idea what happiness is, they don't know that without this love there is no happiness or unhappiness for us--there is no life.”
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.quote: “Happiness. Simple as a glass of chocolate or tortuous as the heart. Bitter. Sweet. Alive.”
quotes.author: Joanne Harris

quotes.quote: “All I ask is one thing, and I’m asking this particularly of young people: please don’t be cynical. I hate cynicism, for the record, it’s my least favorite quality and it doesn’t lead anywhere. Nobody in life gets exactly what they thought they were going to get. But if you work really hard and you’re kind, amazing things will happen.”
quotes.author: Conan O'Brien

quotes.quote: “Happiness is a perfume you cannot pour on others without getting some on yourself.”
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: “Happiness was but the occasional episode in a general drama of pain.”
quotes.author: Thomas Hardy

quotes.quote: “There are as many styles of beauty as there are visions of happiness.”
quotes.author: Stendhal

quotes.quote: “It is sometimes easier to be happy if you don't know everything.”
quotes.author: Alexander McCall Smith

quotes.quote: “Dance. Smile. Giggle. Marvel. TRUST. HOPE. LOVE. WISH. BELIEVE. Most of all, enjoy every moment of the journey, and appreciate where you are at this moment instead of always focusing on how far you have to go.”
quotes.author: Mandy Hale

quotes.quote: “It is difficult to live in and enjoy the moment when you are thinking about the past or worrying about the future. You cannot change your past, but you can ruin the present by worrying about your future. Learn from the past, plan for the future. The more you live in and enjoy the present moment, the happier you will be.”
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “You can't be brave if you've only had wonderful things happen to you.”
quotes.author: Mary Tyler Moore

quotes.quote: “those who do not know how to see the precious things in life will never be happy.”
quotes.author: Alex Flinn

quotes.quote: “When you connect to the silence within you, that is when you can make sense of the disturbance going on around you.”
quotes.author: Stephen Richards

quotes.quote: “Woman is not made to be the admiration of all, but the happiness of one.”
quotes.author: Edmund Burke

quotes.quote: “Everybody in the world is seeking happiness—and there is one sure way to find it. That is by controlling your thoughts. Happiness doesn't depend on outward conditions. It depends on inner conditions.”
quotes.author: Dale Carnegie

quotes.quote: “But what was there to say?
quotes.author: Arundhati Roy

quotes.quote: “The capacity to be alone is the capacity to love. It may look paradoxical to you, but it's not. It is an existential truth: only those people who are capable of being alone are capable of love, of sharing, of going into the deepest core of another person--without possessing the other, without becoming dependent on the other, without reducing the other to a thing, and without becoming addicted to the other. They allow the other absolute freedom, because they know that if the other leaves, they will be as happy as they are now. Their happiness cannot be taken by the other, because it is not given by the other.”
quotes.author: Osho

quotes.quote: “Money may not buy happiness, but I'd rather cry in a Jaguar than on a bus.”
quotes.author: Françoise Sagan

quotes.quote: “We're all golden sunflowers inside.”
quotes.author: allen ginsberg

quotes.quote: “Love is too precious to be ashamed of.”
quotes.author: Laurell K. Hamilton

quotes.quote: “Art is unquestionably one of the purest and highest elements in human happiness. It trains the mind through the eye, and the eye through the mind. As the sun colors flowers, so does art color life.”
quotes.author: John Lubbock

quotes.quote: “The trick is in what one emphasizes. We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves happy. The amount of work is the same.”
quotes.author: Carlos Castaneda

quotes.quote: “Later she remembered all the hours of the afternoon as happy -- one of those uneventful times that seem at the moment only a link between past and future pleasure, but turn out to have been the pleasure itself.”
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quotes.quote: “Just because you are happy it does not mean that the day is perfect but that you have looked beyond its imperfections.”
quotes.author: Bob Marley

quotes.quote: “If you have any young friends who aspire to become writers, the second greatest favor you can do them is to present them with copies of The Elements of Style. The first greatest, of course, is to shoot them now, while they’re happy.”
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.quote: “Nothing makes a person happier than having a happy heart.”
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “Changing your outside world cannot make you happy if you are an unhappy person. The real personal change can only happen from the inside out. If you firstly create the change within yourself, you can turn your life around.”
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “Don’t sacrifice yourself too much, because if you sacrifice too much there’s nothing else you can give and nobody will care for you.”
quotes.author: Karl Lagerfeld

quotes.quote: “And therein lies the whole of man's plight. Human time does not turn in a circle; it runs ahead in a straight line. That is why man cannot be happy: happiness is the longing for repetition.”
quotes.author: Milan Kundera

quotes.quote: “It takes three to make love, not two: you, your spouse, and God. Without God people only succeed in bringing out the worst in one another. Lovers who have nothing else to do but love each other soon find there is nothing else. Without a central loyalty life is unfinished.”
quotes.author: Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.quote: “This life is yours. Take the power to choose what you want to do and do it well. Take the power to love what you want in life and love it honestly. Take the power to walk in the forest and be a part of nature. Take the power to control your own life. No one else can do it for you. Take the power to make your life happy.”
quotes.author: Susan Polis Schutz

quotes.quote: “There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power or our will. ”
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: “If only we'd stop trying to be happy, we could have a pretty good time.”
quotes.author: Edith Wharton

quotes.quote: “I am very happy
quotes.author: Sri Chinmoy

quotes.quote: “I don't think that there are any limits to how excellent we could make life seem.”
quotes.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quotes.quote: “I'm a kind of paranoiac in reverse. I suspect people of plotting to make me happy.”
quotes.author: J.D. Salinger

quotes.quote: “Happiness. It was the place where passion, with all its dazzle and drumbeat, met something softer: homecoming and safety and pure sunbeam comfort. It was all those things, intertwined with the heat and the thrill, and it was as bright within her as a swallowed star.”
quotes.author: Laini Taylor

quotes.quote: “If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.”
quotes.author: Dalai Lama XIV

quotes.quote: “I've always thought people would find a lot more pleasure in their routines if they burst into song at significant moments.”
quotes.author: John Barrowman

quotes.quote: “No one should ever ask themselves that: why am I unhappy? The question carries within it the virus that will destroy everything. If we ask that question, it means we want to find out what makes us happy. If what makes us happy is different from what we have now, then we must either change once and for all or stay as we are, feeling even more unhappy.”
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.quote: “Even if things don't unfold the way you expected, don't be disheartened or give up. One who continues to advance will win in the end.”
quotes.author: Daisaku Ikeda

quotes.quote: “My happiness is not the means to any end. It is the end. It is its own goal. It is its own purpose.”
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.quote: “Life is not a PG feel-good movie. Real life often ends badly. Literature tries to document this reality, while showing us it is still possible for us to endure nobly.”
quotes.author: Matthew Quick

quotes.quote: “The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.”
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: “Happiness is a risk. If you’re not a little scared, then you’re not doing it right.”
quotes.author: Sarah Addison Allen

quotes.quote: “Most of us must learn to love people and use things rather than loving things and using people.”
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “The belief that unhappiness is selfless and happiness is selfish is misguided. It's more selfless to act happy. It takes energy, generosity, and discipline to be unfailingly lighthearted, yet everyone takes the happy person for granted. No one is careful of his feelings or tries to keep his spirits high. He seems self-sufficient; he becomes a cushion for others. And because happiness seems unforced, that person usually gets no credit.”
quotes.author: Gretchen Rubin

quotes.quote: “Certainly the most destructive vice if you like, that a person can have. More than pride, which is supposedly the number one of the cardinal sins - is self pity. Self pity is the worst possible emotion anyone can have. And the most destructive. It is, to slightly paraphrase what Wilde said about hatred, and I think actually hatred's a subset of self pity and not the other way around - ' It destroys everything around it, except itself '.
quotes.author: Stephen Fry

quotes.quote: “Sometimes you break your heart in the right way, if you know what I mean.”
quotes.author: Gregory David Roberts

quotes.quote: “You cannot be with someone just because you don’t want to hurt him. You have your own happiness to think about.”
quotes.author: Melissa de la Cruz

quotes.quote: “It is a curious thing, but as one travels the world getting older and older, it appears that happiness is easier to get used to than despair. The second time you have a root beer float, for instance, your happiness at sipping the delicious concoction may not be quite as enormous as when you first had a root beer float, and the twelfth time your happiness may be still less enormous, until root beer floats begin to offer you very little happiness at all, because you have become used to the taste of vanilla ice cream and root beer mixed together. However, the second time you find a thumbtack in your root beer float, your despair is much greater than the first time, when you dismissed the thumbtack as a freak accident rather than part of the scheme of a soda jerk, a phrase which here means "ice cream shop employee who is trying to injure your tongue," and by the twelfth time you find a thumbtack, your despair is even greater still, until you can hardly utter the phrase "root beer float" without bursting into tears. It is almost as if happiness is an acquired taste, like coconut cordial or ceviche, to which you can eventually become accustomed, but despair is something surprising each time you encounter it.”
quotes.author: Lemony Snicket

quotes.quote: “We buy things we don't need with money we don't have to impress people we don't like.”
quotes.author: Dave Ramsey

quotes.quote: “Success is getting what you want..
quotes.author: Dale Carnegie

quotes.quote: “All who joy would win
quotes.author: George Gordon Byron

quotes.quote: “Be believing, be happy, don't get discouraged. Things will work out.”
quotes.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quotes.quote: “You must be the best judge of your own happiness.”
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: “Happy girls are the prettiest”
quotes.author: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.quote: “We all live with the objective of being happy; our lives are all different and yet the same.”
quotes.author: Anne Frank

quotes.quote: “My past has not defined me, destroyed me, deterred me, or defeated me; it has only strengthened me.”
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.quote: “Plant seeds of happiness, hope, success, and love; it will all come back to you in abundance. This is the law of nature.”
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.quote: “There you go...let it all slide out. Unhappiness can't stick in a person's soul when it's slick with tears.”
quotes.author: Shannon Hale

quotes.quote: “[F]or just one second, look at your life and see how perfect it is. Stop looking for the next secret door that is going to lead you to your real life. Stop waiting. This is it: there's nothing else. It's here, and you'd better decide to enjoy it or you're going to be miserable wherever you go, for the rest of your life, forever.”
quotes.author: Lev Grossman

quotes.quote: “The foundation of irreligious criticism is: Man makes religion, religion does not make man. Religion is, indeed, the self-consciousness and self-esteem of man who has either not yet won through to himself, or has already lost himself again. But man is no abstract being squatting outside the world. Man is the world of man – state, society. This state and this society produce religion, which is an inverted consciousness of the world, because they are an inverted world...
quotes.author: Karl Marx

quotes.quote: “It is a happiness to wonder; -- it is a happiness to dream.”
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.quote: “Puritanism: The haunting fear that someone, somewhere, may be happy.”
quotes.author: H.L. Mencken

quotes.quote: “Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.”
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: “I don't understand the point of being together if you're not the happiest.”
quotes.author: Gillian Flynn

quotes.quote: “She had never imagined she had the power to make someone else so happy. And not a magical power, either--a purely human one.”
quotes.author: Cassandra Clare

quotes.quote: “Only the development of compassion and understanding for others can bring us the tranquility and happiness we all seek.”
quotes.author: Dalai Lama XIV

quotes.quote: “Listen to what is being preached today. Look at everyone around us. You've wondered why they suffer, why they seek happiness and never find it. If any man stopped and asked himself whether he's ever held a truly personal desire, he'd find the answer. He'd see that all his wishes, his efforts, his dreams, his ambitions are motivated by other men. He's not really struggling even for material wealth, but for the second-hander's delusion - prestige. A stamp of approval, not his own. He can find no joy in the struggle and no joy when he has succeeded. He can't say about a single thing: 'This is what I wanted because I wanted it, not because it made my neighbors gape at me'. Then he wonders why he's unhappy.”
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.quote: “If you think the story has a sad ending, it's because it's not over yet.”
quotes.author: Emily Henry

quotes.quote: “Obscurity and a competence—that is the life that is best worth living.”
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: “Happy. Just in my swim shorts, barefooted, wild-haired, in the red fire dark, singing, swigging wine, spitting, jumping, running—that's the way to live. All alone and free in the soft sands of the beach by the sigh of the sea out there, with the Ma-Wink fallopian virgin warm stars reflecting on the outer channel fluid belly waters. And if your cans are redhot and you can't hold them in your hands, just use good old railroad gloves, that's all.”
quotes.author: Jack Kerouac

quotes.quote: “Seize the moments of happiness, love and be loved! That is the only reality in the world, all else is folly. It is the one thing we are interested in here.”
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.quote: “The true measure of success is how many times you can bounce back from failure.”
quotes.author: Stephen Richards

quotes.quote: “Is anyone anywhere happy?”
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath

quotes.quote: “You have to participate relentlessly in the manifestation of your own blessings.”
quotes.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quotes.quote: “There is no beauty in sadness. No honor in suffering. No growth in fear. No relief in hate. It’s just a waste of perfectly good happiness.”
quotes.author: Katerina Stoykova Klemer

quotes.quote: “Happiness depends on being free, and freedom depends on being courageous.”
quotes.author: Marie Rutkoski

quotes.quote: “What disturbs and depresses young people is the hunt for happiness on the firm assumption that it must be met with in life. From this arises constantly deluded hope and so also dissatisfaction. Deceptive images of a vague happiness hover before us in our dreams, and we search in vain for their original. Much would have been gained if, through timely advice and instruction, young people could have had eradicated from their minds the erroneous notion that the world has a great deal to offer them.”
quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quotes.quote: “Memory is the happiness of being alone.”
quotes.author: Lois Lowry

quotes.quote: “Maybe happiness didn't have to be about the big, sweeping circumstances, about having everything in your life in place. Maybe it was about stringing together a bunch of small pleasures. Wearing slippers and watching the Miss Universe contest. Eating a brownie with vanilla ice cream. Getting to level seven in Dragon Master and knowing there were twenty more levels to go.
quotes.author: Ann Brashares

quotes.quote: “There are two ways to be happy: improve your reality, or lower your expectations.”
quotes.author: Jodi Picoult

quotes.quote: “I believe compassion to be one of the few things we can practice that will bring immediate and long-term happiness to our lives. I’m not talking about the short-term gratification of pleasures like sex, drugs or gambling (though I’m not knocking them), but something that will bring true and lasting happiness. The kind that sticks.”
quotes.author: Dalai Lama XIV

quotes.quote: “Happiness only real when shared.”
quotes.author: Christopher McCandless

quotes.quote: “Always forgive, but never forget, else you will be a prisoner of your own hatred, and doomed to repeat your mistakes forever.”
quotes.author: Wil Zeus

quotes.quote: “Because children grow up, we think a child's purpose is to grow up. But a child's purpose is to be a child. Nature doesn't disdain what lives only for a day. It pours the whole of itself into the each moment. We don't value the lily less for not being made of flint and built to last. Life's bounty is in its flow, later is too late. Where is the song when it's been sung? The dance when it's been danced? It's only we humans who want to own the future, too. We persuade ourselves that the universe is modestly employed in unfolding our destination. We note the haphazard chaos of history by the day, by the hour, but there is something wrong with the picture. Where is the unity, the meaning, of nature's highest creation? Surely those millions of little streams of accident and wilfulness have their correction in the vast underground river which, without a doubt, is carrying us to the place where we're expected! But there is no such place, that's why it's called utopia. The death of a child has no more meaning than the death of armies, of nations. Was the child happy while he lived? That is a proper question, the only question. If we can't arrange our own happiness, it's a conceit beyond vulgarity to arrange the happiness of those who come after us.”
quotes.author: Tom Stoppard

quotes.quote: “The secret of happiness is not in doing what one likes, but in liking what one does.”
quotes.author: James Matthew Barrie

quotes.quote: “There are random moments - tossing a salad, coming up the driveway to the house, ironing the seams flat on a quilt square, standing at the kitchen window and looking out at the delphiniums, hearing a burst of laughter from one of my children's rooms - when I feel a wavelike rush of joy. This is my true religion: arbitrary moments of of nearly painful happiness for a life I feel privileged to lead.”
quotes.author: Elizabeth Berg

quotes.quote: “The foolish man seeks happiness in the distance. The wise grows it under his feet.”
quotes.author: James Oppenheim

quotes.quote: “Life is painful. It has thorns, like the stem of a rose. Culture and art are the roses that bloom on the stem. The flower is yourself, your humanity. Art is the liberation of the humanity inside yourself.”
quotes.author: Daisaku Ikeda

quotes.quote: “Perfect love casts out fear. Where there is love there are no demands, no expectations, no dependency. I do not demand that you make me happy; my happiness does not lie in you. If you were to leave me, I will not feel sorry for myself; I enjoy your company immensely, but I do not cling.”
quotes.author: Anthony de Mello

quotes.quote: “If I had a camera," I said, "I'd take a picture of you every day. That way I'd remember how you looked every single day of your life."
quotes.author: Nicole Krauss

quotes.quote: “To see and feel one's beloved naked for the first time is one of life's pure, irreducible epiphanies. If there is a true religion in the universe, it must include that truth of contact or be forever hollow. To make love to the one true person who deserves that love is one of the few absolute rewards of being a human being, balancing all of the pain, loss, awkwardness, loneliness, idiocy, compromise, and clumsiness that go with the human condition. To make love to the right person makes up for a lot of mistakes.”
quotes.author: Dan Simmons

quotes.quote: “Laughter is a sunbeam of the soul.”
quotes.author: Thomas Mann

quotes.quote: “Rules for happiness: something to do, someone to love, something to hope for.”
quotes.author: Immanuel Kant

quotes.quote: “When you lose your smile, you lose your way in the chaos of life.”
quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.quote: “I was something that lay under the sun and felt it, like the pumpkins, and I did not want to be anything more. I was entirely happy. Perhaps we feel like that when we die and become a part of something entire, whether it is sun and air, or goodness and knowledge. At any rate, that is happiness; to be dissolved into something complete and great. When it comes to one, it comes as naturally as sleep.”
quotes.author: Willa Cather

quotes.quote: “Happiness doesn't lie in conspicuous consumption and the relentless amassing of useless crap. Happiness lies in the person sitting beside you and your ability to talk to them. Happiness is clear-headed human interaction and empathy. Happiness is home. And home is not a house-home is a mythological conceit. It is a state of mind. A place of communion and unconditional love. It is where, when you cross its threshold, you finally feel at peace.”
quotes.author: Dennis Lehane

quotes.quote: “A woman laughing is a woman conquered.”
quotes.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.quote: “Happiness is a gift and the trick is not to expect it, but to delight in it when it comes.”
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.quote: “Maybe you think you’ll be entitled to more happiness later by forgoing all of it now, but it doesn’t work that way. Happiness takes as much practice as unhappiness does. It’s by living that you live more. By waiting you wait more. Every waiting day makes your life a little less. Every lonely day makes you a little smaller. Every day you put off your life makes you less capable of living it.”
quotes.author: Ann Brashares

quotes.quote: “Some day you will find out that there is far more happiness in another's happiness than in your own.”
quotes.author: Honoré de Balzac

quotes.quote: “I consider myself a stained-glass window. And this is how I live my life. Closing no doors and covering no windows; I am the multi-colored glass with light filtering through me, in many different shades. Allowing light to shed and fall into many many hues. My job is not to direct anything, but only to filter into many colors. My answer is destiny and my guide is joy. And there you have me.”
quotes.author: C. JoyBell C.

quotes.quote: “Age does not make us childish, as some say; it finds us true children.”
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: “I shall take the heart. [...] For brains do not make one happy, and happiness is the best thing in the world.”
quotes.author: L. Frank Baum

quotes.quote: “Oh, how unbearable is a happy person sometimes!”
quotes.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quotes.quote: “To be stupid, selfish, and have good health are three requirements for happiness, though if stupidity is lacking, all is lost.”
quotes.author: Gustave Flaubert

quotes.quote: “Destiny is real. And she's not mild-mannered. She will come around and hit you in the face and knock you over and before you know what hit you, you're naked- stripped of everything you thought you knew and everything you thought you didn't know- and there you are! A bloody nose, bruises all over you, and naked. And it's the most beautiful thing.”
quotes.author: C. JoyBell C.

quotes.quote: “In fact no one recognizes the happiest moment of their lives as they are living it. It may well be that, in a moment of joy, one might sincerely believe that they are living that golden instant "now," even having lived such a moment before, but whatever they say, in one part of their hearts they still believe in the certainty of a happier moment to come. Because how could anyone, and particularly anyone who is still young, carry on with the belief that everything could only get worse: If a person is happy enough to think he has reached the happiest moment of his life, he will be hopeful enough to believe his future will be just as beautiful, more so.”
quotes.author: Orhan Pamuk

quotes.quote: “It was that impossible thing: happiness that does not wilt to reveal the thin shoots of some new desire rising from within it.”
quotes.author: George Saunders

quotes.quote: “nothing wonderful lasted forever. Joy was as fleeting as a shooting star that crossed the evening sky, ready to blink out at any moment.”
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks

quotes.quote: “The more you talk about it, rehash it, rethink it, cross analyze it, debate it, respond to it, get paranoid about it, compete with it, complain about it, immortalize it, cry over it, kick it, defame it, stalk it, gossip about it, pray over it, put it down or dissect its motives it continues to rot in your brain. It is dead. It is over. It is gone. It is done. It is time to bury it because it is smelling up your life and no one wants to be near your rotted corpse of memories and decaying attitude. Be the funeral director of your life and bury that thing!”
quotes.author: Shannon L. Alder

quotes.quote: “My only regrets are the moments when i doubted myself and took the safe route. Life is too short to waste time being unhappy.”
quotes.author: Dan Howell

quotes.quote: “Happiness is like those palaces in fairytales whose gates are guarded by dragons: We must fight in order to conquer it.”
quotes.author: Alexandre Dumas

quotes.quote: “Why? Why does what was beautiful suddenly shatter in hindsight because it concealed dark truths? Why does the memory of years of happy marriage turn to gall when our partner is revealed to have had a lover all those years? Because such a situation makes it impossible to be happy? But we were happy! Sometimes the memory of happiness cannot stay true because it ended unhappily. Because happiness is only real if it lasts forever? Because things always end painfully if they contained pain, conscious or unconscious, all along? But what is unconscious, unrecognized pain?”
quotes.author: Bernhard Schlink

quotes.quote: “إن السعادة هي أن أشرب كوب شاي.. مع صديق.. في لحظة رضا.”
quotes.author: محمد المخزنجي

quotes.quote: “right in this moment, I can´t even remember what unhappy feels like.”
quotes.author: Maggie Stiefvater

quotes.quote: “What sunshine is to flowers, smiles are to humanity. These are but trifles, to be sure; but scattered along life's pathway, the good they do is inconceivable.”
quotes.author: Joseph Addison

quotes.quote: “And I didn't choose it, Kat. I chose you.”
quotes.author: Ally Carter

quotes.quote: “There is a kind of happiness and wonder that makes you serious. It is too good to waste on jokes.”
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.quote: “Happiness was never important. The problem is that we don't know what we really want. What makes us happy is not to get what we want. But to dream about it. Happiness is for opportunists. So I think that the only life of deep satisfaction is a life of eternal struggle, especially struggle with oneself. If you want to remain happy, just remain stupid. Authentic masters are never happy; happiness is a category of slaves.”
quotes.author: Slavoj Žižek

quotes.quote: “I may never be happy, but tonight I am content.”
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath

quotes.quote: “That’s life for you. All the happiness you gather to yourself, it will sweep away like it’s nothing. If you ask me I don’t think there are any such things as curses. I think there is only life. That’s enough.”
quotes.author: Junot Diaz

quotes.quote: “I may never be happy, but tonight I am content. Nothing more than an empty house, the warm hazy weariness from a day spent setting strawberry runners in the sun, a glass of cool sweet milk, and a shallow dish of blueberries bathed in cream. When one is so tired at the end of a day one must sleep, and at the next dawn there are more strawberry runners to set, and so one goes on living, near the earth. At times like this I'd call myself a fool to ask for more...”
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath

quotes.quote: “Anne was always glad in the happiness of her friends; but it is sometimes a little lonely to be surrounded everywhere by happiness that is not your own.”
quotes.author: L.M. Montgomery

quotes.quote: “Of all the means to insure happiness throughout the whole life, by far the most important is the acquisition of friends.”
quotes.author: Epicurus

quotes.quote: “The reason people find it so hard to be happy is that they always see the past better than it was, the present worse than it is, and the future less resolved than it will be.”
quotes.author: Marcel Pagnol

quotes.quote: “Ahhh. Bed, book, kitten, sandwich. All one needed in life, really.”
quotes.author: Jacqueline Kelly

quotes.quote: “Human happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected.”
quotes.author: George Washington

quotes.quote: “dear today,
quotes.author: Nina LaCour

quotes.quote: “A man wants to earn money in order to be happy, and his whole effort and the best of a life are devoted to the earning of that money. Happiness is forgotten; the means are taken for the end.”
quotes.author: Albert Camus
